titleStmt.title: Computational Efficiency: A Common Organizing Principle for Parallel Computer Maps and Brain Maps?

affiliation.orgName: Computation and Neural Systems Program Division of Biology
Computation and Neural Systems Program Division of Biology
Computation and Neural Systems Program Division of Biology

analytic.title: Computational Efficiency: A Common Organizing Principle for Parallel Computer Maps and Brain Maps?

abstract.p: It is well-known that neural responses in particular brain regions are spatially organized, but no general principles have been developed that relate the structure of a brain map to the nature of the associated computation. On parallel computers, maps of a sort quite similar to brain maps arise when a computation is distributed across multiple processors. In this paper we will discuss the relationship between maps and computations on these computers and suggest how similar considerations might also apply to maps in the brain.
